# Satuso

> Satuso is a modern sales CRM built for solopreneurs and small teams. It helps users track leads, manage their sales pipeline, automate follow-ups, and close more deals.

## Product Overview

Satuso is a web-based sales tracking and CRM (Customer Relationship Management) platform. It is designed specifically for solopreneurs, freelancers, consultants, and small sales teams (1-10 people) who need a simple yet powerful tool to manage their sales process without the complexity and cost of enterprise CRM software like Salesforce or HubSpot.

## Core Features

- **Visual Sales Pipeline**: Drag-and-drop Kanban boards for managing deals through customizable stages (Lead, Qualified, Proposal, Negotiation, Closed Won/Lost).
- **AI-Powered Insights**: Intelligent deal scoring and recommendations that help users prioritize which leads to focus on and when to follow up.
- **SPIN Selling Methodology**: The only CRM with built-in SPIN selling framework. Users can track Situation, Problem, Implication, and Need-Payoff notes for every deal.
- **Contact & Company Management**: Organize contacts and companies with custom fields, tags, and relationship tracking.
- **Deal Teams**: Collaborate on complex deals by assigning team members and resources to specific opportunities.
- **Custom Workboards**: Create personalized views and dashboards for contacts, companies, and deals.
- **Analytics Dashboard**: Track pipeline value, conversion rates, revenue trends, and team performance metrics.
- **Follow-Up Reminders**: Automated task reminders to ensure no lead falls through the cracks.

## Pricing

- **Standard Plan**: $29/month — includes up to 5 users, unlimited deals and contacts, visual pipeline, AI insights, SPIN selling, custom workboards, analytics, and email support.
- **Enterprise Plan**: Custom pricing — includes everything in Standard plus unlimited users, priority support, custom integrations, dedicated account manager, SSO, advanced security, and SLA guarantee.

## Target Audience

Satuso is built for:
- Solopreneurs and independent consultants
- Freelancers who sell services
- Small sales teams (1-10 people)
- Startups that need a simple CRM
- Anyone currently tracking deals in spreadsheets
